title: Stock Futures Edge Up After Selloff; Oil Rally Builds
sub_head: S&P 500 on course to open higher, while technology stocks look set to pare some of Monday’s sharp losses
body:
U.S. stock futures rose, a day after a selloff among some of America’s biggest technology firms dragged down broader indexes, while investors also contended with surging energy prices.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 edged up 0.4%, while tech-heavy Nasdaq-100 futures added 0.6%, suggesting indexes could recover some of Monday’s losses. Blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average Futures rose 0.4%.
